default: (a) a {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|phb}

optionalfeature.name: Bullying Shot
entries: Come azione, potete spendere un punto Grinta e sparare con la vostra arma, usando il potente scoppio e il suono tonante che produce per scuotere la determinazione del vostro nemico. Tutte le creature ostili entro 9 piedi, che possono vedervi e sentirvi, devono superare un tiro salvezza di Saggezza o diventare {@condition frightened} di voi per 1 minuto. Una creatura può ripetere il tiro salvezza alla fine di ogni suo turno, terminando l'effetto in caso di successo.

optionalfeature.name: Cauterizing Shot
entries: Si può usare la canna calda dell'arma per cauterizzare una ferita. Come azione bonus dopo aver effettuato un attacco con arma da fuoco, si può spendere un punto Grinta per recuperare punti ferita pari a {@dice 1d10} + metà del proprio livello da armaiolo.

optionalfeature.name: Dazing Shot
entries: Quando si effettua un attacco con armi da fuoco contro una creatura, si può spendere un punto Grinta per tentare di stordirne l'avversario. Se viene colpita, la creatura subisce danni normali e deve effettuare un tiro salvezza per la Costituzione o diventa {@condition stunned} fino alla fine del vostro turno successivo.

optionalfeature.name: Deadeye Shot
entries: Quando si effettua un attacco con armi da fuoco contro una creatura, si può spendere un punto Grinta per ottenere un vantaggio sul tiro di attacco.

optionalfeature.name: Disarming Shot
entries: Quando si effettua un attacco con armi da fuoco contro una creatura, si può spendere un punto Grinta per tentare di sparare a un oggetto dalle sue mani. Se viene colpita, la creatura subisce danni normali e deve riuscire in un tiro salvezza di Forza o far cadere un oggetto a scelta tra quelli tenuti in mano e spingerlo a 3 metri di distanza.

optionalfeature.name: Forceful Shot
entries: Quando si effettua un attacco con armi da fuoco contro una creatura, si può spendere un punto Grinta per cercare di farla inciampare e costringerla a indietreggiare. Se viene colpita, la creatura subisce danni normali e deve riuscire in un tiro salvezza di Forza o essere spinta a 15 piedi di distanza da voi.

optionalfeature.name: Fan the Hammer
entries: Quando si effettua un attacco con arma da fuoco contro una creatura, si possono spendere uno o più punti Grinta per effettuare attacchi aggiuntivi contro quella creatura, facendo vibrare il martello dell'arma. Si effettua un numero di attacchi aggiuntivi pari al numero di punti Grinta spesi. L'attacco iniziale viene effettuato normalmente, ma ogni attacco successivo aggiunge un +2 cumulativo al punteggio di tiro mancino dell'arma.

optionalfeature.name: Piercing Shot
entries: Quando si effettua un attacco con arma da fuoco contro una creatura, si può spendere un punto Grinta per tentare di sparare attraverso più avversari. L'attacco iniziale guadagna un +1 al punteggio di tiro mancino dell'arma. Se si va a segno, la creatura subisce danni normali e si effettua un tiro per colpire con svantaggio contro ogni creatura in fila direttamente dietro al bersaglio entro il primo incremento di gittata. Solo l'attacco iniziale può fare cilecca.

optionalfeature.name: Pistol Whip
entries: Come azione o reazione, si può spendere un punto Grinta per effettuare un attacco in mischia improvvisato con l'impugnatura dell'arma da fuoco. Si tratta l'arma come se avesse la proprietà finezza e si effettua l'attacco con competenza infliggendo {@damage 1d8} + il proprio modificatore di Destrezza danni da randellate al colpo.

optionalfeature.name: Ricocheting Shot
entries: Quando si effettua un attacco con arma da fuoco contro una creatura, si può spendere un punto Grit per ignorare qualsiasi copertura del bersaglio, inclusa la copertura totale, purché si sia vista la creatura entrare in copertura e ci sia un modo per far rimbalzare il colpo verso il bersaglio (a discrezione del DM).

optionalfeature.name: Violent Shot
entries: Quando si effettua un attacco con arma da fuoco contro una creatura, si possono spendere uno o più punti Grinta per migliorare la volatilità dell'attacco. Per ogni punto Grinta speso, l'attacco guadagna un +1 al punteggio di tiro mancino dell'arma. Se l'attacco va a segno, si tira un dado di danno da arma aggiuntivo per ogni punto Grinta speso per determinare il danno.

optionalfeature.name: Winging Shot
entries: Quando si effettua un attacco con armi da fuoco contro una creatura, si può spendere un punto Grinta per tentare di far cadere un bersaglio in movimento. Se viene colpita, la creatura subisce danni normali e deve effettuare un tiro salvezza di Forza o essere sbalzata {@condition prone}.

classFeature.name: Gunsmithing
entries: A partire dal 1° livello, è possibile iniziare a creare armi da fuoco di propria progettazione, le cui regole sono riportate alla fine di questa descrizione di classe. La capacità di creare armi da fuoco è determinata dall'Abilità di Fabbricare, che aumenta man mano che si guadagnano livelli in questa classe, in base alla colonna Abilità di Fabbricare della tabella Armiere. Ci sono sei opzioni per la creazione di armi.

classFeature.name: Crack Shot
entries: A partire dal 2° livello, si impara a eseguire potenti colpi di prestigio per disattivare o danneggiare gli avversari usando le armi da fuoco.

entries.name: Grit
entries: Si guadagna un numero di punti grinta determinato dal proprio livello di Armiere, come indicato nella colonna Punti grinta della tabella Armiere. I punti grinta vengono utilizzati per eseguire i tiri di prestigio. Si recupera 1 punto grinta speso ogni volta che si tira un 20 al tiro di d20 per un attacco con un'arma da fuoco o si infligge un colpo mortale con un'arma da fuoco a una creatura di CR maggiore o uguale alla metà del proprio livello. Si recuperano tutti i punti grinta spesi dopo un riposo lungo.

entries.name: Trick Shots
entries: You learn two {@filter Trick Shot|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=Gun:TS} options of your choice. You learn an additional Trick Shot of your choice at 7th, 9th, 13th, 15th and 20th level. Many Trick Shots enhance an attack in some way. Each use of a Trick Shot must be declared before the attack roll is made. You can only use one Trick Shot per attack. If a Trick Shot says it increases the misfire score of your firearm, the increase only effects that attack. Some of your Trick Shots require your targets to make a saving throw to resist the Trick Shot's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

classFeature.name: Shooting Style
entries: At 3rd level, you choose to specialise in a particular shooting style. The style you choose grants you features at 3rd level and again at 6th, 10th, 14th and 17th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: {@i 4th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill proficiency offered by your class at 1st level (the proficiency you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.
The number of attacks increases to three when you reach 11th level in this class.

classFeature.name: Shooting Style feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Shooting Style.

classFeature.name: Quickdraw
entries: When you reach 7th level, you add your proficiency bonus to your initiative. You can also stow a firearm and draw another firearm as a single object interaction on your turn.

classFeature.name: Crack Shot (3 trick shots)
entries: At 7th level, you learn one additional trick shot of your choice.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: {@i 8th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill proficiency offered by your class at 1st level (the proficiency you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: Rapid Repair
entries: Upon reaching 9th level, you learn how to quickly attempt to fix a jammed gun. You can spend a Grit point to attempt to repair a misfired (but not broken) firearm as a bonus action.

classFeature.name: Crack Shot (4 trick shots)
entries: At 9th level, you learn one additional trick shot of your choice.

classFeature.name: Shooting Style feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your Shooting Style.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack (2)
entries: At 11th level, you can attack three times whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: {@i 12th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill proficiency offered by your class at 1st level (the proficiency you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: Lightning Reload
entries: Starting at 13th level, your practice and familiarity with firearms makes reloading them second nature. You can reload any firearm as a bonus action.

classFeature.name: Crack Shot (5 trick shots)
entries: At 13th level, you learn one additional trick shot of your choice.

classFeature.name: Shooting Style feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature granted by your Shooting Style.

classFeature.name: Crack Shot (6 trick shots)
entries: At 15th level, you learn one additional trick shot of your choice.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: {@i 16th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill proficiency offered by your class at 1st level (the proficiency you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: Shooting Style feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Shooting Style.

classFeature.name: Hemorrhaging Critical
entries: Upon reaching 18th level, whenever you score a critical hit on an attack with a firearm, the target additionally suffers half of the damage from the attack at the end of its next turn.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Proficiency Versatility
entries: {@i 19th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill proficiency offered by your class at 1st level (the proficiency you replace needn't be from the class).
This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

classFeature.name: True Grit
entries: At 20th level, your boundless resolve allows you to draw upon a limitless well of grit. Whenever, you start your turn with less than half your maximum Hit Points and have no Grit points remaining, you immediately regain 1 Grit point.

Additionally, choose one {@filter Trick Shot|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=Gun:TS} option you already know. You can now perform this Trick Shot once without expending a Grit point and regain the ability to do so after a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Crack Shot (7 trick shots)
entries: At 20th level, you learn one additional trick shot of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Marksman
entries: A gunsmith's lethality with ranged weapons is nigh unmatched except by the most skilled of archers, but a marksman's unwavering accuracy is unmatched by all. What they lack in raw power they more than make up for with their ability to consistently hit their target, and there are few targets a marksman cannot hit.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Arsenal
entries: When you choose this shooting style at 3rd level, you gain access to a new Gunsmithing option, Sniper Rifles. The rules for crafting and using rifles are listed at the end of this class description along with the rest of the gunsmithing options.

subclassFeature.name: Marksman's Eye
entries: Beginning at 6th level, you train yourself to ensure your eye never leaves your target. You can cast the {@spell hunter's mark|phb} spell once at 1st-level and regain the ability to do so after a short or long rest.
Additionally, the benefits of your {@optfeature Deadeye Shot|Rhyzler:Gunsmithing} now extend to every firearm attack you make that turn.

subclassFeature.name: Steady Breathing
entries: At 10th level your steady breathing helps you ignore the distractions of the battlefield, allowing you to zone in on your target. As a bonus action, you can expend one Grit point to ignore disadvantage on firearm attacks against one creature of your choice until the end of your turn.

Alternatively, you can expend one Grit point in the same fashion to end one of the following conditions affecting you: {@condition Blinded}, {@condition Deafened}, {@condition Frightened} or {@condition Stunned}.

subclassFeature.name: Unrelenting Aim
entries: By 14th level staying on target has become second nature to you. Whenever you make a firearm attack, you can treat a {@dice d20} roll of 7 or lower as an 8, unless the roll would cause your firearm to misfire.

subclassFeature.name: Vicious Intent
entries: At 17th level, your firearm attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19-20, and you regain a Grit point on a roll of 19 or 20 on a d20 attack roll with a firearm.
